verses.verse: Then Deborah<WH1683> and Barak<WH1301> the son<WH1121> of Abinoam<WH42> sang<WH7891> on that day,<WH3117> saying,<WH559>
"That the leaders<WH6546> led<WH9460> in Israel,<WH3478> That the people<WH5971> volunteered,<WH5068> Bless<WH1288> the Lord!<WH3068>

"Hear,<WH8085> O kings;<WH4428> give<WH238> ear,<WH238> O rulers!<WH7336> I – to the Lord,<WH3068> I will sing,<WH7891> I will sing<WH2167> praise<WH2167> to the Lord,<WH3068> the God<WH430> of Israel.<WH3478>

"Lord,<WH3068> when Thou didst go<WH3318> out from Seir,<WH8165> When Thou didst march<WH6805> from the field<WH7704> of Edom,<WH9000> The earth<WH776> quaked,<WH7493> the heavens<WH8064> also<WH1571> dripped,<WH5197> Even<WH1571> the clouds<WH5645> dripped<WH5197> water.<WH4325>
"The mountains<WH2022> quaked<WH5140> at the presence<WH6440> of the Lord,<WH3068> This<WH2088> Sinai,<WH5514> at the presence<WH6440> of the Lord,<WH3068> the God<WH430> of Israel.<WH3478>

"In the days<WH3117> of Shamgar<WH8044> the son<WH1121> of Anath,<WH6067> In the days<WH3117> of Jael,<WH3278> the highways<WH734> were deserted,<WH2308> And travelers<WH1980> <WH9350> went<WH1980> by roundabout<WH6128> ways.<WH734>
"The peasantry<WH6520> ceased,<WH2308> they ceased<WH2308> in Israel,<WH3478> Until<WH5704> I, Deborah,<WH1683> arose,<WH6965> Until I arose,<WH6965> a mother<WH517> in Israel.<WH3478>

"New<WH2319> gods<WH430> were chosen;<WH977> Then<WH227> war<WH3901> [was] in the gates.<WH8179> Not a shield<WH4043> or a spear<WH7420> was seen<WH7200> Among forty<WH705> thousand<WH505> in Israel.<WH3478>
"My heart<WH3820> [goes out] to the commanders<WH2710> of Israel,<WH3478> The volunteers<WH5068> among the people;<WH5971> Bless<WH1288> the Lord!<WH3068>
"You who ride<WH7392> on white<WH6715> donkeys,<WH860> You who sit<WH3427> on [rich] carpets,<WH4055> And you who travel<WH1980> on the road<WH1870> – sing!<WH7878>

"At the sound<WH6963> of those who divide<WH9160> [flocks] among<WH996> the watering<WH4857> places,<WH4857> There<WH8033> they shall recount<WH8567> the righteous<WH6666> deeds<WH6666> of the Lord,<WH3068> The righteous<WH6666> deeds<WH6666> for His peasantry<WH6520> in Israel.<WH3478> Then<WH227> the people<WH5971> of the Lord<WH3068> went<WH3381> down<WH3381> to the gates.<WH8179>

"Awake,<WH5782> awake,<WH5782> Deborah;<WH1683> Awake,<WH5782> awake,<WH5782> sing<WH1696> a song!<WH7892> Arise,<WH6965> Barak,<WH1301> and take<WH7617> away your captives,<WH7628> O son<WH1121> of Abinoam.<WH42>
"Then<WH227> survivors<WH8300> came<WH3381> down<WH3381> to the nobles;<WH117> The people<WH5971> of the Lord<WH3068> came<WH3381> down<WH3381> to me as warriors.<WH1368>

"From Ephraim<WH669> those whose root<WH8328> is in Amalek<WH6002> [came<WH3381> down,<WH3381>] Following<WH310> you, Benjamin,<WH1144> with your peoples;<WH9415> From Machir<WH4353> commanders<WH2710> came down, And from Zebulun<WH2074> those who wield<WH4900> the staff<WH7626> of office.<WH9373>

"And the princes<WH8269> of Issachar<WH3485> [were] with Deborah;<WH1683> As [was] Issachar,<WH3485> so<WH3651> [was] Barak;<WH1301> Into the valley<WH6010> they rushed<WH7971> at his heels;<WH7272> Among the divisions<WH6390> of Reuben<WH7205> [There were] great<WH1419> resolves<WH2706> of heart.<WH3820>

"Why<WH4100> did you sit<WH3427> among<WH996> the sheepfolds,<WH4942> To hear<WH8085> the piping<WH8292> for the flocks<WH5739>? Among the divisions<WH6390> of Reuben<WH7205> [There were] great<WH1419> searchings<WH2714> of heart.<WH3820>

"Gilead<WH1568> remained<WH7931> across<WH5676> the Jordan;<WH3383> And why<WH4100> did Dan<WH1835> stay<WH1481> in ships<WH591>? Asher<WH836> sat<WH3427> at the seashore,<WH3220> <WH2348> And remained<WH7931> by its landings.<WH4664>
"Zebulun<WH2074> [was] a people<WH5971> who despised<WH2778> their lives<WH5315> [even] to death,<WH4191> And Naphtali<WH5321> also, on the high<WH4791> places<WH4791> of the field.<WH7704>

"The kings<WH4428> came<WH935> [and] fought;<WH3898> Then<WH227> fought<WH3898> the kings<WH4428> of Canaan<WH3667> At Taanach<WH8590> near<WH5921> the waters<WH4325> of Megiddo;<WH4023> They took<WH3947> no<WH3808> plunder<WH1215> in silver.<WH3701>
"The stars<WH3556> fought<WH3898> from heaven,<WH8064> From their courses<WH4546> they fought<WH3898> against<WH5973> Sisera.<WH5516>

"The torrent<WH5158> of Kishon<WH7028> swept<WH1640> them away,<WH1640> The ancient<WH6917> torrent,<WH5158> the torrent<WH5158> Kishon.<WH7028> O my soul,<WH5315> march<WH1869> on with strength.<WH5797>
"Then<WH227> the horses' hoofs<WH6119> beat<WH1986> From the dashing,<WH1726> the dashing<WH1726> of his valiant<WH47> steeds.<WH47>

'Curse<WH779> Meroz,<WH4789>' said<WH559> the angel<WH4397> of the Lord,<WH3068> 'Utterly<WH779> curse<WH779> its inhabitants;<WH3427> Because<WH3588> they did not come<WH935> to the help<WH5833> of the Lord,<WH3068> To the help<WH5833> of the Lord<WH3068> against the warriors.<WH1368>'
"Most blessed<WH1288> of women<WH802> is Jael,<WH3278> The wife<WH802> of Heber<WH2268> the Kenite;<WH7017> Most blessed<WH1288> is she of women<WH802> in the tent.<WH168>
"He asked<WH7592> for water<WH4325> [and] she gave<WH5414> him milk;<WH2461> In a magnificent<WH117> bowl<WH5602> she brought<WH7126> him curds.<WH2529>

"She reached<WH7971> out her hand<WH3027> for the tent<WH3489> peg,<WH3489> And her right<WH3225> hand<WH3225> for the workmen's hammer.<WH1989> Then she struck<WH1986> Sisera,<WH5516> she smashed<WH4277> his head;<WH7218> And she shattered<WH4272> and pierced<WH2498> his temple.<WH7541>

"Between<WH996> her feet<WH7272> he bowed,<WH3766> he fell,<WH5307> he lay;<WH7901> Between<WH996> her feet<WH7272> he bowed,<WH3766> he fell;<WH5307> Where<WH834> he bowed,<WH3766> there<WH8033> he fell<WH5307> dead.<WH7703>

"Out of the window<WH2474> she looked<WH8259> and lamented,<WH2980> The mother<WH517> of Sisera<WH5516> through<WH1157> the lattice,<WH822> 'Why<WH4069> does his chariot<WH7393> delay<WH309> in coming<WH935>? Why<WH4069> do the hoofbeats<WH6471> of his chariots<WH4818> tarry<WH309>?'
"Her wise<WH2450> princesses<WH8282> would answer<WH6030> her, Indeed<WH637> she repeats<WH7725> her words<WH561> to herself,

'Are they not finding,<WH4672> are they not dividing<WH2505> the spoil<WH7998>? A maiden,<WH7358> two maidens<WH7358> for every<WH7218> warrior;<WH1397> To Sisera<WH5516> a spoil<WH7998> of dyed<WH6648> work,<WH6648> A spoil<WH7998> of dyed<WH6648> work<WH6648> embroidered,<WH7553> Dyed<WH6648> work<WH6648> of double embroidery<WH7553> on the neck<WH6677> of the spoiler<WH7998>?'

"Thus<WH3651> let all<WH3605> Thine enemies<WH340> perish, O Lord;<WH6> But let those who love<WH3068> Him be like the rising<WH157> of the sun<WH3318> in its might.<WH8121>" And the land<WH1369> was undisturbed<WH776> for forty<WH8252> years.<WH705>
